intro: Erodium pimpinellifolium var. subalbidum, commonly known as the subalbid lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, pink to white flowers and trifoliate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This annual species typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant is part of the Geraniaceae family and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
